info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 26 at 8:32AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
At 832 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing funnel clouds 8 miles northwest of Vancleave, or 14 miles north of St. Martin, moving north at 20 mph.
HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...If a funnel cloud briefly touches down, minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Biloxi, Ocean Springs, St. Martin, D'iberville, Latimer, Gulf Hills, Gulf Park Estates, and Vancleave.
This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 43 and 57. Interstate 110 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 4.
info.instruction:
Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors or to safe harbor and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in New Orleans.
A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for southern Mississippi.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN HARRISON AND WESTERN JACKSON COUNTIES THROUGH 915 AM CDT

area.areaDesc: Northern Harrison; Northern Jackson; Southern Harrison; Southern Jackson
